intro: Macrolobium multijugum var. multijugum, commonly known as the African violet, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub with thick, fleshy stems and broad, waxy leaves. Its flowers are usually trumpet-shaped, with five lobes, and come in a variety of colors including purple, pink, and white. The plant is well adapted to humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value.
